member.summary: Handles status messages generated when operations are performed on an or .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage
member.summary: Provides access to powerful build, maintenance, and analysis operations on an installation package (.MSI or .MSM).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.DatabaseOpenMode)
member.summary: Creates a new InstallPackage object. The file source directory and working directory are the same as the location as the package file.
member.param: Path to the install package to be created or opened
Open mode for the database

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.DatabaseOpenMode,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new InstallPackage object, specifying an alternate file source directory and/or working directory.
member.param: Path to the install package to be created or opened
Open mode for the database

Location to obtain source files and cabinets when extracting or updating files in the working directory. This is often the location of an original copy of the package that is not meant to be modified. If this parameter is null, it defaults to the directory of .
Location where files will be extracted to/updated from. Also the location where a temporary folder is created during some operations. If this parameter is null, it defaults to the directory of .
member.remarks: If the source location is different than the working directory, then no files will be modified at the source location.

member.summary: Sends a message to the event-handler.
member.param: Message string, containing 0 or more format items
Items to be formatted

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.FindFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the list of file keys that have the specified long file name.
member.param: File name to search for (case-insensitive)
member.returns: Array of file keys, or a 0-length array if none are found

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.FindFiles(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex)
member.summary: Gets the list of file keys whose long file names match a specified regular-expression search pattern.
member.param: Regular expression search pattern
member.returns: Array of file keys, or a 0-length array if none are found

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.ExtractFiles
member.summary: Extracts all files to the . The files are extracted to the relative directory matching their .
member.remarks: If any files have the uncompressed attribute, they will be copied from the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.ExtractFiles(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.String})
member.summary: Extracts a specified list of files to the . The files are extracted to the relative directory matching their .
member.param: List of file key strings to extract
member.remarks: If any files have the uncompressed attribute, they will be copied from the .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.UpdateFiles
member.summary: Updates the install package with new files from the . The files must be in the relative directory matching their . This method re-compresses and packages the files if necessary, and also updates the following data: File.FileSize, File.Version, File.Language, MsiFileHash.HashPart*
member.remarks: The cabinet compression level used during re-cabbing can be configured with the property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.UpdateFiles(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.String})
member.summary: Updates the install package with new files from the . The files must be in the relative directory matching their . This method re-compresses and packages the files if necessary, and also updates the following data: File.FileSize, File.Version, File.Language, MsiFileHash.HashPart?.
member.param: List of file key strings to update
member.remarks:
This method does not change the media structure of the package, so it may require extracting and re-compressing a large cabinet just to update one file.
The cabinet compression level used during re-cabbing can be configured with the property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.Consolidate(System.String)
member.summary: Consolidates a package by combining and re-compressing all files into a single internal or external cabinet.
member.remarks:
If an installation package was built from many merge modules, this method can somewhat decrease package size, complexity, and installation time.
This method will also convert a package with all or mostly uncompressed files into a package where all files are compressed.
If the package contains any not-yet-applied binary file patches (for example, a package generated by a call to ) then this method will apply the patches before compressing the updated files.
This method edits the database summary information and the File, Media and Patch tables as necessary to maintain a valid installation package.
The cabinet compression level used during re-cabbing can be configured with the property.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.UpdateDirectories
member.summary: Rebuilds the cached directory structure information accessed by the and properties. This should be done after modifying the File, Component, or Directory tables, or else the cached information may no longer be accurate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.ApplyPatch(Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage,System.String)
member.summary: Applies a patch package to the database, resulting in an installation package that has the patch built-in.
member.param: The patch package to be applied
Optional name of the specific transform to apply. This parameter is usually left null, which causes the patch to be searched for a transform that is valid to apply to this database.
member.remarks:
If the patch contains any binary file patches, they will not immediately be applied to the target files, though they will at installation time.
After calling this method you can use to apply the file patches immediately and also discard any outdated files from the package.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.Message
member.summary: Handle this event to receive status messages when operations are performed on the install package.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the location where files will be extracted to/updated from. Also the location where a temporary folder is created during some operations.

member.remarks: If the Directory table is modified, this mapping will be outdated until you call .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.Files
member.summary: Gets a mapping from File keys to source/target paths.
member.remarks: If the File, Component, or Directory tables are modified, this mapping may be outdated until you call .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression level used by and .
member.remarks: If the Directory table is modified, this mapping will be outdated until you close and reopen the install package.

member.summary: Accessor for getting and setting properties of the InstallPackage database.

member.summary: Accessor for getting and setting properties of the database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackageProperties.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets a property in the database. When getting a property that does not exist in the database, an empty string is returned. To remove a property from the database, set it to an empty string.
member.remarks: This has the same results as direct SQL queries on the Property table; it's only meant to be a more convenient way of access.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage
member.summary: Provides access to convenient properties and operations on a patch package (.MSP).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new patch package object; opening the patch database in read-only mode.
member.param: Path to the patch package (.MSP)
member.remarks: The PatchPackage object only opens the patch database in read-only mode, because transforms (sub-storages) cannot be read if the database is open in read-write mode.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.LogMessage(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Sends a message to the event-handler.
member.param: Message string, containing 0 or more format items
Items to be formatted

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetReplacedPatchCodes
member.summary: Gets the list of patch codes that are replaced by this patch package.
member.returns: Array of replaced patch codes (GUIDs)
member.remarks: The list of replaced patch codes is stored in the RevisionNumber field of the patch summary information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetTargetProductCodes
member.summary: Gets the list of product codes of products targeted by this patch package.
member.returns: Array of product codes (GUIDs)
member.remarks: The list of target product codes is stored in the Template field of the patch summary information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetTransforms
member.summary: Gets the names of the transforms included in the patch package.
member.returns: Array of transform names
member.remarks:
The returned list does not include the "patch special transforms" that are prefixed with "#"
The list of transform names is stored in the LastSavedBy field of the patch summary information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetTransforms(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the names of the transforms included in the patch package.
member.param: Specifies whether to include the "patch special transforms" that are prefixed with "#"
member.returns: Array of transform names
member.remarks: The list of transform names is stored in the LastSavedBy field of the patch summary information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetTransformsInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the transforms included in the patch package.
member.returns: Array containing information about each transform
member.remarks: The returned info does not include the "patch special transforms" that are prefixed with "#"

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetTransformsInfo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets information about the transforms included in the patch package.
member.param: Specifies whether to include the "patch special transforms" that are prefixed with "#"
member.returns: Array containing information about each transform

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetTransformInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Gets information about a transforms included in the patch package.
member.param: Name of the transform to extract; this may optionally be a special transform prefixed by "#"
member.returns: Information about the transform

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.GetValidTransforms(Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.InstallPackage)
member.summary: Analyzes the transforms included in the patch package to find the ones that are applicable to an install package.
member.param: The install package to validate the transforms against
member.returns: Array of valid transform names
member.remarks: The returned list does not include the "patch special transforms" that are prefixed with "#" If a transform is valid, then its corresponding special transform is assumed to be valid as well.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Deployment.WindowsInstaller.Package.PatchPackage.ExtractTransform(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts a transform (.MST) from a patch package.
member.param: Name of the transform to extract; this may optionally be a special transform prefixed by "#"
Location where the transform will be extracted
